en.title: Public realm strategy and design guide

content.val: The Crown Estate has been working with Atkins since 1997 on improving the public realm of the Regent Street and St James’s portfolios and a great deal of knowledge and experience has been acquired over this period. The purpose of the app is to share this knowledge with other members of development teams to provide a clearer understanding of how The Crown Estate operates when dealing with the public realm.

The deliverables were a Sharepoint intranet site, website and an iPad app. LeafletJS was used for mapping the project areas on the website and the site was packaged as an iPad app using Apache Cordova.
I was responsible for building the front-end using HTML5, CSS3 and BackboneJS and used Sharepoint REST APIs as backend

content.tech: HTML5, LESS, BackboneJS, RequireJS, Leaflet, Sharepoint, Cordova
content.urlText: Public Realm Strategy and Design Guide

content.val: Atkins Acuity is the advisory business in Atkins group helping clients to successfully deliver their big ambitions for infrastructure and energy worldwide.
I was part of the development team on both fron-end and back-end
The Strategic Road Network makes up a small proportion of the national highway network but has an important role to play in supporting journeys made by cycle.

Increasing highway design professionals’ engagement and knowledge of key requirements in the planning and design of infrastructure for cycle traffic was the objective of the delivery. An interactive and comprehensive set of e-learning modules were produced to give guidance on designing for cycle traffic.
Utilising cutting edge elearning platforms such an Adapt framework with mini game interactions built in Unity created a dynamic and technologically advanced e-learning.

I was responsible for the feasibilty study of technologies like Adapt learning framework and Unity for the simulations and interactivity on web. Also managed the collaboration between Unity and Web development team from conceptual stage to delivery.

The Big Bang Fair is the UK’s largest Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) annual exhibition. The event attracted around 50,000 seven to nineteen year olds with an aim of encourage youngsters to pursue a STEM career by highlighting how engineering impacts everyday life.

To support the event two educational and fun facts games were developed. One game would challenge players to ensure the correct level and type of power was supplied to a city based on a scenario given, while the other would require them to solve problems associated with connecting water lines. Both games were timed based increased in complexity as the player progressed through the stages. Games were presented on two separate touch screens held within an eco-friendly themed house.

Both games were developed using Adobe Air and Starling game engine. I was responsible for the development of these games and assisted the the design team to create and optimize the assets for the games.
HMEP is the Highways Maintenance Efficiency Programme, which exists to support the sector on its journey to transform highway services.

HMEP Asset Management E-Learning Toolkit has been based on the contents of the HMEP Highway Infrastructure Asset Management Guidance. The Guidance helps all those delivering highway services, including senior decision makers, asset managers, service providers and practitioners, to embed asset management principles in their organisations and make the case for funding highway maintenance.
This training material, endorsed by the Chartered Institution of Highways & Transportation (CIHT) is available to access online freely.

I was responsible for working with the subject experts in Atkins and our in-house design team to develop a SCORM compliant e-learning toolkit which is highly interactive and easy to use. The course modules were developed using Adobe Flash and a custom Learning Management System was developed using Moodle for user management and progress tracking.

HCD Concept Analysis Tool will help building designers make informed decisions taking into account the effect of wellbeing in the early concept stages of design. This tool allows engineers to upload a 3D model of the building from Autodesk Revit and Analyse it.
My main responsibility on this ongoing project was to develop front-end of the tool with charting capabilities. User interface of the tool was deeloped using angularJS and MaterializeCSS.
Registration app and a realtime dashboard for the ELT event at Arcelormittal Orbit in London.

I was responsible for setting up the Firebase Realtime Database backend using Google Cloud Functions. Also implemented the Lottie SVG animations on the dashboard using Bodymovin plugin for Adobe Aftereffects.

content.tech: HTML5, SASS, Materialize, Firebase, Google Functions, Lottie, Bodymovin, Adobe After effects

Network Rail was proposing to improve the railway between Oxford and Bedford, and Milton Keynes, Aylesbury and Princes Risborough by upgrading disused and underused rail track to provide a new rail link between these important conurbations, and provide additional routes and capacity for both passengers and freight.
On completion, this new rail link will connect the Great Western, Chiltern, West Coast and Midland Main Lines north of London and become a vital strategic rail link in Britain’s rail network.

As a part of this proposal, Network Rail was running a series of public consultations. We supported this event by developing an app to collect feedbacks from public. This app was published on web, apple appstore and android play store.

I was responsible for working with the subject experts in Atkins and our in-house design team to develop a SCORM compliant e-learning toolkit which is highly interactive and easy to use. The course modules were developed using Adobe Flash and a custom Learning Management System was developed using Moodle for user management and progress tracking.

The FearFighter™ program is the only product endorsed by a national regulator – National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence (NICE) in the UK for an Anxiety Treatment. This is an evidence-based, online program that teaches you how to confront and change your thoughts and allows you to print worksheets for activities, to monitor progress, and receive emails with further tips at the end of each step.
Developed various interactive activities and questionnaires in this product and integrated it with the .net backend for tracking progress.

Pitch Space is a bespoke presentation tool developed for Faithful+Gould which allows users to easily create and share presentations from a list of pre-built templates following the company brand guidelines. This tool was developed using SailsJS and mySQL as the database.

A curated collection of photos, videos and illustrations called Pitch Stock was also created as a part of this project. This allowed the users to create their own personal collection of assets and import it into their presentations.

content.tech: HTML5, SASS, AngularJS, NodeJS, SailsJS, Bootstrap, MySQL, Sharepoint

content.val: Sherston Software provides schools and nurseries within the U.K. and internationally with educational technology products, designed to nurture and motivate children as well as improve their performance. These software also enables teachers to easily assess, feedback, and report students’ progress.

I worked with course authors, teachers and animators and developed various e-learning courses using Adobe Flash and Actionscript for clients like Oxford University Press, BBC and Sherston. These courses were published as interactive CDROMs and SCORM compliant courses in planetsherston.com.

content.tech: HTML, CSS, Flash, Actionscript 3.0, XML, SCORM
